Erik Wilde: Platform Engineering: Useful or Agile Wine in New Bottles?

(2) Summary

Platform Engineering is one of the big trends of the recent past. Why is it important and what are the main success factors of platform engineering? The easiest way to get started is by understanding platforms as a way for more efficient development: Achieving economies of scale by pushing repeated work into the platform. A bit more advanced is to use platforms as a vehicle for standardization: By making opinionated decisions, you encourage and support teams to adopt a shared set of tools and technologies. The most challenging factor is to use platforms as a way to boost innovation: When teams start contributing their products to the platform, collaboration effort is reduced and the platform becomes a digital representation of your organization's core capabilities. We will look at these success factors in detail and also discuss specific steps you can take to get the most out of your platform investments.



Erik Wilde: Platform Engineering: Useful or Agile Wine in New Bottles?

(5) Platforms!

  • We're building an API platform and will be API First.
  • We're building a platform for our partners.
  • Our developers need a better platform.
  • We're moving to the cloud platform.
  • We want to become a platform.

(10) The Developer World is Complex

  • Source Control & Collaboration: GitHub
  • Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD): Jenkins
  • Infrastructure as Code: Terraform
  • Containerization & Orchestration: Kubernetes
  • Monitoring & Observability: Datadog
  • Logging: Splunk
  • Secrets Management: HC Vault
  • Package Management & Artifact Repositories: npm
  • Configuration Management: Chef
  • API Management: Kong

(16) Avoid Terminology Debates

  • Focus on the motivation for the platform ambition
  • Connect the dots across various ambitions and plans
  • Connecting business outcomes to IT initiatives is the most powerful tool you have


Business Impact of Platforms Erik Wilde: Platform Engineering: Useful or Agile Wine in New Bottles?

(18) Platform Value

  • More Efficient Development: Internal Developer Platform
  • More Effective Collaboration: API Portals/Marketplaces
  • Digital Transformation: Digital/Business Platform
  • Becoming a Platform: Platform Business Model

Conclusions Erik Wilde: Platform Engineering: Useful or Agile Wine in New Bottles?

(20) Various Stakeholders

  • Developers: Improve flow through automation
  • Operations: Decrease complication through standardization
  • Business: Discover and realize value through optionality


Conclusions Erik Wilde: Platform Engineering: Useful or Agile Wine in New Bottles?

(21) Building Better Platforms

  • Platform is a fuzzy term
  • A platform strategy aligns and guides platform efforts
  • Balance efforts across all platform efforts
  • APIs play a vital part in all (technical) platforms


Conclusions Erik Wilde: Platform Engineering: Useful or Agile Wine in New Bottles?
